intro: Blakea incompata, commonly known as the yellow blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters during the rainy season. It typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial plant, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
